transcription: Thunder Marine presents Living for Water Life's Tip of the Week with Vince Noble and Captain Jim Pollard.  First thing after a long day of fishing you're going to be tired and what not. Just take your time filleting them and make sure you get as much meat off as you can. Keep that sharpener there. Use it, especially on certain fish that have big bones. And another thing to keep in mind, how do you plan on preparing your fish? How do you plan on cooking it? Some fish want it like it's staked. Some fish, smoked, skin on, skin off. Just different things to think about when you go and do your filleting of your fish.
